lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Kai.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Kai.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
What can I do for you?
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here
* Kai is the main control logic for chatbot functionality
* Constructor for the main chatbot class
* @param filePath where the Tasks are stored on disk
* Main logic loop for the chatbot
* Initial entry point of the entire application,
* creates a Kai class to handle further details
* KaiException is a custom Exception class
* to enable easier passing of messages for debugging
* Constructor for the exception with the given message
* Class to keep the logic of parsing input in one place.
* Parses a string representing a Task and transforms it into an actual Task
* @param state the string representation of the Task
* @return the Task corresponding to that representation
public static Task parseStoredTask(String state) throws IllegalArgumentException {
* Parses the command given and takes the appropriate response thereof.
public static void parseCommand(String input, TaskList tasks, Scanner sc) {
throw new KaiException("\t There are no tasks to list. Congratulations!");
System.out.println("\t Here are the tasks in your list:");
throw new KaiException("\t There is no task corresponding to the number you entered, " +
System.out.println("\t Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("\t The task number specified is invalid, please retry.");
throw new KaiException("\t There is no task corresponding to the number you entered, " +
System.out.println("\t Ok, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
System.out.println("\t The task number specified is invalid, please retry.");
throw new KaiException("\t There is no task corresponding to the number you entered, " +
System.out.println("\t Noted. This task has been removed:");
System.out.println("\t " + "There is now " + tasks.size() + " task(s) in the list.");
System.out.println("\t The task number specified is invalid, please retry.");
if (input.length() < 6) throw new KaiException("\t The todo command must have a name for the task.");
if (!input.contains(" /by ")) throw new KaiException("\t The deadline command requires ' /by ' without the quotation marks " +
"and then the deadline to work properly.");
if (desc.isEmpty()) throw new KaiException("\t The deadline command must have a name for the task.");
throw new KaiException("\t The event command requires ' /from ' without the quotation marks, " +
"\t and then ' /to ' without the quotation marks " +
"followed by the second date to work properly.");
if (desc.isEmpty()) throw new KaiException("\t The event command must have a name for the task.");
} else throw new KaiException("\t I'm sorry, I don't recognise your command, " +
"the currently supported (case-sensitive, without the quotation marks) commands are:" +
"Did you forget to add a space at the end of the commands to input arguments if applicable?");
System.out.println("\t " + "There is now " + tasks.size() + " task(s) in the list.");
System.out.println("\t  would love to help you, but could you please give me more to work with?");
* Storage handles the storage and retrieval of Tasks
* Constructs Storage with the appropriate path to retrieve or store Tasks in
* Loads all the Tasks found in the file to memory
Ui.showLoadingError("\t The loading of Task " + numLines + " failed as it was corrupted in disk.");
" tasks failed to load from disk.");
Ui.showLoadingError("\t Warning: There is no save file for Tasks, and one could not be created.");
Ui.showLoadingError("\t Warning: There is no save file for Tasks, and one could not be created.");
* Saves the current Tasks to the file on disk
* @param tasks the Tasks to be saved
fw.write(""); // clean out the file for saving
* For managing the list of Task in an encapsulated manner
* Constructor of TaskList with the given tasks
* @param tasks the list of tasks in the class
* Add a Task to the TaskList
* @param task the Task to be added
* Remove a Task from the TaskList, based on the index given
* @param index the index of the Task to be deleted
* Check if the TaskList is empty and return accordingly
* @return a boolean about if the TaskList is empty
* To check the size of the TaskList
* @return the number of Tasks in the TaskList
* Ui handles output to the screen
* Prints out the appropriate message for the type of loading error that occurred
* @param message The error message or warning in question
* Prints out the welcome message to the chatbot
System.out.println("\t What can I do for you?");
* Prints out the exit message of the chatbot and then force exits.
System.out.println("\t Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Deadline implements Task with additional deadline functionality
* Constructs a new Deadline with the specified description and deadline
* @param desc the description of the Task
* @param deadline the deadline of the Task
* Event implements Task with start and end date information
* Construct a new ToDo with the specified description, start and end date
* @param desc the description of the Task
* @param from the start date of the Task (does not need to be a Date)
* @param to the end date of the Task (does not need to be a Date)
public Event(String desc, String from, String to) {
* Framework for a Task for the rest of the chatbot to work with
* Marked as abstract for easy inheritance for other subclasses
* Constructs a Task with the relevant description,
* marking it as incomplete at the start
* @param desc the description of the Task
* Marks the task as complete (even if the task is already complete)
* Marks the task as incomplete (even if the task is currently incomplete)
* Ensures that classes that inherit can have its state preserved by Storage for later recreation
* @return String that can be parsed by Storage to recreate the Task
* ToDo is a concrete version of Task with no special functionality.
* Constructs a new ToDo with the specified description
* @param desc the description of the Task
